text: dear Sarah I am so bored with all my
broccoli application so what should I do
no one ever actually wrote me that
letter but I have your solution if you
are bored with your broccoli you need to
start making this roasted broccoli with
lemon and almond right now what you want
to do is cut up your broccoli into
florets I kind of like a little longer
florets oh that's how I cut mine but
feel free to cut yours however you like
and have your oven preheating to 450
degrees the original recipe is for two
heads of broccoli I'm only doing one
just cuz well there's only me now I'm
just kidding
just as easy to show with one head is to
but if you're doing two heads of
broccoli you're gonna want to use two
baking sheets so there's plenty of room
for browning the recipe says a
tablespoon of olive oil as you can see
I'm being slightly more generous but
that's me you can do with as little as a
tablespoon if you like I like it to be a
little bit more oily because you get a
little bit more crisp enos spread it out
in the single-leg season with salt and
pepper and then get into a 450 degree
oven until they're sort of golden brown
around the edges maybe bordering a
little bit on blackened about 15 to 18
minutes straight out of the oven what
you want to do is sprinkle with some
lemon zest about a teaspoon per tray for
like the zest of one lemon probably I
like to do it right over the hot
broccoli because it really absorbs the
flavors that way and then also the juice
about a tablespoon and a half mmm you
can do a variation on this with sauteing
as well same exact flavors are great on
sauteed broccoli this is a quarter cup
of toasted almonds and your side dish is
done fantastic just give it a little bit
toss
mmm smells kind of toasty and nutty and
fantastic lemon zest the lemon juice the
nuts all of it work really well together
roasted broccoli is going to be your new
go-to way to cook broccoli I guarantee
it
you
